title: Two goals against Tottenham but who is Brighton's new wonderkid Aaron Connolly?
text:
Who is he?

Aaron Connolly may not have been a household name before his match-winning turn for Brighton against Tottenham on Saturday - the first time an Irish teenager scored twice in a Premier League game since Robbie Keane for Coventry in 1999 - but he certainly is now.

This was the 19-year-old's full Premier League debut and his two goals showed he has all the attributes to be a force for some time - the first was a classic poacher's finish, the second a beautifully curled shot.

How does he play?

His second goal against Spurs was reminiscent of his boyhood idol Thierry Henry but it is Keane whom Connolly most closely resembles.
